signals.problem_statement: The customer support team is overwhelmed by the volume of emails, with around 200 emails received daily, leading to inefficiencies in handling queries.
signals.customer_ask: A system that can deflect repetitive tickets automatically.

signals.problem_statement: There is no ticketing system in place, making it difficult to track and manage customer queries effectively.
signals.customer_ask: A ticketing system to manage customer queries.

signals.problem_statement: Multiple customer support specialists responding to the same email leads to confusion and inconsistency in customer communication.
signals.customer_ask: A way to ensure only one person responds to each email.

signals.problem_statement: The current system does not allow for clear visibility on who is working on which tickets, leading to potential overlaps and missed responses.
signals.customer_ask: A system that provides visibility on ticket ownership and status.

signals.problem_statement: The team is using password sharing to access a common inbox, which raises security concerns and complicates tracking of individual contributions.
signals.customer_ask: Individual logins for team members to access the shared inbox.

signals.problem_statement: There is no effective way to flag and track technical issues reported by customers, leading to delays in addressing these problems.
signals.customer_ask: A summary or flagging system for recurring technical issues.
